title: Kenya Moore reflects on a 'bittersweet' moment that reminds
text:
She announced her split from husband Marc Daly after two years of marriage just weeks ago.

And Kenya Moore revealed some of her true feelings about their separation in a recent Instagram post.

The 48-year-old Real Housewives of Atlanta star opened up in a photo update following the 21st Annual Corps de Ballet Fashion Show & Luncheon at St. Regis Atlanta alongside ballerina Misty Copeland.

Real: Kenya Moore revealed some of her true feelings about their separation in a recent Instagram post

She began the post gushing over her chance to meet Misty, saying: 'Today I met @mistyonpointe one of my IDOLS. As a little black girl who didn’t have money for ballet and dance classes, my grandmother took us to free community classes and that’s when I fell in love with dance.'

Kenya continued: 'Listening to Misty I learned she had a similar story. And now she is the FIRST black woman lead ballerina of an international dance company! She is as beautiful and graceful in person as she is on the stage.'

She then took a beat to reflect on memories she shared with Marc at last year's event.

Happier times: She then took a beat to reflect on memories she shared with Marc at last year's event

'Thank you Josh for inviting me again this year. It was bittersweet as my husband and I were there together last year and Brooklyn (in my belly),' she recalled.

The reality star announced her split from Marc to the public last month.

'It is with profound sadness that I regret to inform my fans that I am divorcing my husband Marc Daly,' she told People in a statement.

All in the family! The reality star announced her split from Marc to the public last month. Here they are with daughter Brooklyn in a recent Instagram post

'Due to recent and ongoing circumstances, I can no longer continue in the marriage. My sole concern and focus is and will always be my daughter.'

The two walked down the aisle in a surprise ceremony in St. Lucia in 2017.

Kenya and Marc went through a public journey with in-vitro fertilization as Kenya struggled to get pregnant.

By June 2018 she had posted an ultrasound proving she was indeed pregnant at age 49.

She gave birth to Brooklyn in November of last year.
